TopicTitle: Engines won't immediately start, SAS is borked, and no option to revert flight

Articles.Content:
KSP Version: .25

Mods: B9 Aerospace 5.2.6 and Active Texture Management 3-8

How to Reproduce: Any pod with any rocket

The problem:Any rocket I build, be it a gargantuan station launcher or a probe core with a Sepratron stuck to it, has the same problem. The engines won't ignite until about ten seconds after I activate them (Yes there is fuel and electricity). Then when I activate SAS, it tries to send my rocket or spaceplane into a roll. After it inevitably crashes, it won't give me the option to revert flight. The options to revert flight and the option to return to the VAB/SPH are completely omitted. On top of that, the little staging sequence icons on the left of the screen are gone as well. This makes it difficult to fly a rocket.

Log:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/m7hbphka3bn9ocl/output_log.txt?dl=0
Looks like you maybe need to make a clean install and install the latest B9? Bunch of exceptions in the log from RPM.
This is with a fresh install of both Kerbal and the latest b9. Previous versions work though. I would just like the updated stufg to work

Delete the JSI folder and download it from here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57603-0-25-RasterPropMonitor-putting-the-A-in-your-IVA-%28v0-18-3%29-8-Oct

The latest version should be included since B9 5.2.5, but who knows... I had more than once problems with the RPM version B9 came with. Now I'm always using the one from the RPM site, not from B9.
